Class OwnerOnly

Initializes a new instance of the OwnerOnly class, intended for owner-only operations within the Mewdeko bot framework.

Initializes a new instance of the OwnerOnly class, intended for owner-only operations within the Mewdeko bot framework.

Declaration
public OwnerOnly(DiscordSocketClient client, Mewdeko bot, IBotStrings strings, InteractiveService serv, ICoordinator coord, IEnumerable<IConfigService> settingServices, DbService db, IDataCache cache, CommandService commandService, IServiceProvider services, GuildSettingsService guildSettings, CommandHandler commandHandler)
Parameters
Type Name Description
DiscordSocketClient client

The Discord client used to interact with the Discord API.
Mewdeko bot

The main instance of the Mewdeko bot.
IBotStrings strings

Provides access to localized strings within the bot.
InteractiveService serv

Interactive service for handling interactive user commands.
ICoordinator coord

Coordinator for managing bot operations across different services and modules.
IEnumerable<IConfigService> settingServices

A collection of configuration services for managing bot settings.
DbService db

Service for database operations and access.
IDataCache cache

Cache service for storing and retrieving temporary data.
CommandService commandService

Service for handling and executing Discord commands.
IServiceProvider services

The service provider for dependency injection.
GuildSettingsService guildSettings

Service for accessing and modifying guild-specific settings.
CommandHandler commandHandler

Handler for processing and executing commands received from users.

AutoCommandAdd(int, string)

Adds an auto command to be executed periodically in the specified guild.

Declaration
[Cmd("AutoCommandAdd")]
[Aliases("AutoCommandAdd")]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
[OwnerOnly]
public Task AutoCommandAdd(int interval, string cmdText)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int interval

The interval in seconds at which the command should be executed. Must be 5 seconds or more.
string cmdText

The command text to be executed automatically.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Requires the user to have Administrator permissions or to be the owner of the bot. The command will not be added if it fails any precondition checks, if it matches a forbidden command (e.g., a command to shut down the bot), or if the maximum number of auto commands (15) for the guild has been reached.

| Edit this page View Source

AutoCommandRemove(int)

Removes an auto command based on its index.

Declaration
[Cmd("AutoCommandRemove")]
[Aliases("AutoCommandRemove")]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
[OwnerOnly]
public Task AutoCommandRemove(int index)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int index

The one-based index of the auto command to remove.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Requires the user to have Administrator permissions or to be the owner of the bot. The command will decrement the index to match zero-based indexing before attempting removal. If the removal fails, an error message is sent.

| Edit this page View Source

AutoCommandsList(int)

Lists the auto commands configured for the guild.

Declaration
[Cmd("AutoCommandsList")]
[Aliases("AutoCommandsList")]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[OwnerOnly]
public Task AutoCommandsList(int page = 1)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int page

The page number of the list to display, starting from 1.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Displays a paginated list of auto commands. Each page shows up to 5 commands. Requires the user to be the owner of the bot and the command to be executed in a guild context. If there are no auto commands set, an error message is displayed.

| Edit this page View Source

Bash(string)

Executes a bash command. Depending on the platform, the command is executed in either bash or PowerShell.

Declaration
[Cmd("Bash")]
[Aliases("Bash")]
public Task Bash(string message)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string message

The command to execute.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

The command is executed in a new process, and the output is sent as a paginated message. If the process hangs, it is terminated. The command has a timeout of 2 hours. The output is split into chunks of 1988 characters to avoid Discord message limits.

| Edit this page View Source

Declaration
[Cmd("ClearUsedTokens")]
[Aliases("ClearUsedTokens")]
public Task ClearUsedTokens()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command prompts the user for confirmation before proceeding to clear the used token count. If the user confirms, it clears the count and notifies the user of completion.

CommandStats()

Retrieves and displays statistics on the most used command, module, guild, and user.

Declaration
[Cmd("CommandStats")]
[Aliases("CommandStats")]
public Task CommandStats()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method calculates and reports the top entities based on their usage count. It displays the most frequently used command, the module that's used the most, the user who has used commands the most, and the guild with the highest command usage. These statistics are presented as an embed in the Discord channel.

Remarks

Parameters
Type Name Description

Task
Remarks

Declaration
[Cmd("ShardStats")]
[Aliases("ShardStats")]
public Task ShardStats()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command aggregates the current status of all shards and displays a summary followed by a detailed paginated list of each shard's status, including the time since last update, guild count, and user count. The statuses are represented by emojis for quick visual reference.

Parameters

The SQL command to execute.

Remarks

Prompts the user for confirmation before executing the SQL command. The number of affected rows is sent back as a message in the Discord channel. Use with caution, as executing raw SQL can directly affect the database integrity.

Sudo(IGuildUser, string)

Executes a command as if it were sent by the specified guild user.

Declaration
[Cmd("Sudo")]
[Aliases("Sudo")]
public Task Sudo(IGuildUser user, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IGuildUser user

The guild user to impersonate when executing the command.
string args

The command string to execute, including command name and arguments.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method constructs a fake message with the specified user as the author and the given command string, then enqueues it for command parsing and execution.

Sudo(string)

Executes a command as if it were sent by the owner of the guild.

Declaration
[Cmd("Sudo")]
[Aliases("Sudo")]
public Task Sudo(string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string args

The command string to execute, including command name and arguments.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method constructs a fake message with the guild owner as the author and the given command string, then enqueues it for command parsing and execution. Useful for performing actions that require owner permissions.

Wait(int)

Executes a wait command that delays for a specified number of milliseconds.

Declaration
[Cmd("Wait")]
[Aliases("Wait")]
public Task Wait(int miliseconds)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int miliseconds

The number of milliseconds to delay.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

The command message is immediately deleted, and a new message showing the delay is sent. This message is then deleted after the delay period has passed. If the provided milliseconds value is less than or equal to 0, the command does nothing.

Implements

Discord.Commands.IModuleBase

Extension Methods

Extensions.ThrowIfNull<T>(T, string)
